questions.question: According to the psychology of group healing (Lesson 1), which of Irvin Yalom's therapeutic factors is most critical for reducing the 'shame-isolation cycle' in new mothers?
options: Altruism
Universality
Existential factors
Imitative behavior
Universality
questions.explanation: Universality is the recognition of shared experiences, which helps postpartum clients realize they are not alone, directly dismantling the isolation that fuels postpartum mood disorders.

questions.question: In the R.E.S.T.O.R.E. Group Framework, what does the 'S' represent, and why is it sequenced early in the curriculum?
options: Sleep Hygiene; to ensure cognitive function for later lessons
Social Support; to build trust between participants immediately
Somatic Regulation; to stabilize the nervous system before processing emotional content
Scheduling; to help mothers find time for the program
questions.explanation: Somatic Regulation is placed early (Lesson 2) because a dysregulated nervous system cannot effectively process the 'Reconstruction' and 'Transformation' phases of the framework.

questions.question: A participant in your group program frequently 'trauma dumps,' sharing graphic details that trigger other members. According to Advanced Facilitation Skills (Lesson 3), what is the most professional response?
options: Mute the participant immediately and continue the lesson
Use 'The Compassionate Pivot' to acknowledge the pain while refocusing on the group's collective safety
Allow them to finish to avoid making them feel unheard
Ask the other members how the story made them feel to encourage 'Mirroring'
questions.explanation: The Compassionate Pivot allows the coach to maintain boundaries and group safety without shaming the individual, preserving the 'container' of the group.

questions.question: Which workshop model is specifically designed as a 'High-Ticket Gateway' to convert attendees into premium group coaching programs?
options: The 60-Minute Free Webinar
The 3-Day 'Fourth Trimester' Intensive
The Monthly Coffee Chat
The Asynchronous Email Course
questions.explanation: Lesson 4 identifies the multi-day 'Intensive' as a high-impact model that builds enough trust and demonstrates enough value to lead into a high-ticket ($997+) group program.

questions.question: When building a Hybrid Coaching model (Lesson 5), what is the 'Golden Ratio' of asynchronous vs. synchronous content for maximum retention?
options: 90% recorded / 10% live
10% recorded / 90% live
70% recorded (curriculum) / 30% live (implementation/Q&A)
50% recorded / 50% live
questions.explanation: A 70/30 split is the industry standard for premium hybrid programs, allowing for scalable delivery while maintaining the high-touch support mothers need.

questions.question: In the 'Marketing & Launch' phase (Lesson 6), why is a 'Beta Launch' recommended before a full public release?
options: To make a quick profit with lower marketing costs
To gather 'Social Proof' and refine the curriculum based on real-time feedback
Because you cannot legally sell a program without a beta test
To limit the number of people who see the content
questions.explanation: Beta launches are essential for gathering testimonials (Social Proof) and ensuring the R.E.S.T.O.R.E. framework resonates with the specific cohort before scaling.

questions.question: Which specific metric mentioned in Lesson 7 is used to measure the 'soft ROI' of a postpartum group program?
options: The Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS) delta (pre vs. post program)
Total number of Instagram followers gained during the launch
The cost-per-click (CPC) of the Facebook ads
The number of modules completed by the average user
questions.explanation: The 'EPDS Delta'—the change in depression screening scores—is a powerful clinical metric that demonstrates the program's efficacy and outcome-based value.

questions.question: According to the Ethics & Boundaries lesson (Lesson 8), what is the 'Red Flag' disclosure that requires an immediate transition from group coaching to clinical referral?
options: A participant mentioning they haven't showered in two days
A participant expressing frustration with their partner
A participant disclosing thoughts of self-harm or harm to the infant
A participant crying during a somatic breathing exercise
questions.explanation: Safety is the highest priority. Disclosures of self-harm or infanticide ideation fall outside the coaching scope and require immediate clinical intervention and referral.

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of 'Cohort-Based Learning' compared to 'Evergreen' (self-paced) programs in postpartum recovery?
options: It is cheaper for the coach to manage
It creates 'Relational Accountability' and increases completion rates by up to 40%
It allows the coach to take more time off
It requires less technology to implement
questions.explanation: Cohort-based programs leverage the power of community, significantly increasing engagement and completion rates compared to isolated, self-paced courses.

questions.question: When calculating the ROI of group coaching (Lesson 7), if a coach moves from 1:1 sessions ($150/hr) to a group of 10 ($500/person for 8 weeks), what is the primary economic advantage?
options: Lowering the price for the client
Reducing the coach's taxes
Increasing the 'Hourly Yield' while decreasing 'Direct Labor Hours'
Eliminating the need for a website
questions.explanation: Group coaching dramatically increases the 'Hourly Yield' (the amount earned per hour of live coaching), allowing the coach to scale their income without burning out.
